discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
When creating Workspace ONE Intelligence Dashboards, what helps visualize collected data are:

B. Widgets

Widgets are the components used within Workspace ONE Intelligence Dashboards to display and visualize collected data in various formats, such as charts, graphs, tables, and other visual representations. They allow administrators to present data in a meaningful and easy-to-understand way.

questions.question_text: When creating Workspace ONE Intelligence Dashboards, what helps visualize collected data?

choices.D: Devices with Application and User Details Report

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The Intelligence report that could help organize and display the collected sensor data for a specific registry value in a Windows app is:

B. Custom Report

A Custom Report can be configured to display specific data collected by sensors, making it a suitable choice for organizing and displaying the collected sensor data in a customized format according to the administrator's preferences and requirements.

questions.question_text:
An administrator has configured a sensor to fetch a specific registry value for a Windows app.

Which Intelligence report could help organize and display the collected sensor data?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
To enable AD-authenticated end users to access enterprise SharePoint documents through the Workspace ONE Content application, the company should plan for the following on-premises servers/services:

A. Unified Access Gateway (UAG): Unified Access Gateway is used to provide secure remote access to internal resources, including SharePoint documents. It ensures secure access for remote users while maintaining network and data security.

D. AirWatch Cloud Connector: The AirWatch Cloud Connector is used to integrate on-premises infrastructure, including Active Directory, with the Workspace ONE UEM SaaS environment. It plays a crucial role in user authentication and access control.

The other options (B, C, and E) may have other use cases but are not typically required specifically for enabling AD-authenticated access to SharePoint documents through the Workspace ONE Content application.

questions.question_text:
A company has purchased a Workspace ONE UEM SaaS environment and are planning the on-premises servers and services that will be required. A primary use case is allowing AD authenticated end users to access enterprise SharePoint documents through the Workspace ONE Content application.

Which two on-premises servers/services should the company plan for? (Choose two.)

choices.B: Change the help desk accounts to user accounts.
choices.D: Prevent all access by help-desk accounts.
choices.C: Use Directory-Based Access for help desk employees.
choices.A: Use Role-Based Access for help desk employees.

questions.question_text:
An administrator is concerned about help desk employees having the Console Administrator role. The help desk employees only need to access the device list view page and perform minor troubleshooting steps.

Which console security feature can eliminate the administrators concern?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BCE
B,C and D
